notes.text: Graduate-level coursework in operating systems, computer architecture, algorithms, and control theory.

items.title: COSC 562 - Operating Systems: Design and Implementation
items.subtitle: Advanced operating system concepts focusing on design and implementation of file systems, memory management, process management, and system-level programming.

items.title: COSC 530 - Computer Systems Organization
items.subtitle: Exploration of central issues in computer architecture: instruction set design, memory hierarchies, pipelining, instruction-level parallelism, and multiprocessor systems.

items.title: COSC 581 - Algorithms
items.subtitle: Advanced design and analysis of algorithms with focus on asymptotics, relative efficiencies, and implementation strategies.

items.title: ECE 511 - Linear Systems Theory
items.subtitle: State space models of linear dynamical systems, covering controllability, observability, realization theory, and stability analysis.
